alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 4:32PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Rock Island, Whiteside, north central Henry, eastern Scott and southeastern Clinton Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 432 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Emerson to near McCausland. Movement was south at 15 mph. These slow moving storms will bring significant ponding of water to area roads. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Princeton, Long Grove and McCausland around 435 PM CDT. Eldridge around 440 PM CDT. Bettendorf around 450 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Davenport, Hampton, Moline, Rock Island, East Moline, Prophetstown, Tampico and Riverdale. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 293 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 74 in Illinois near mile marker 1. Interstate 88 between mile markers 5 and 41. Interstate 280 between mile markers 8 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
